results.title: Three views from an ivory tower
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A lesser stone-poet; a scientific builder and the inventor of the ultimate weapon. Each in their own ivory tower thinks they have created their own ideal, and the others had nothing to do with “true creativity” - but they did! Music by Gerrit Bratt. Animation Workshop 1963.

results.title: Three types of welds
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Gas Welding”
Part of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures, through flame adjustments. This part describes the types of welds that can be used in gas welding.

results.title: Three trains north
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
Journey out to the last frontier on three separate trains. First on the Gulflander, described as “heroic,” even “eccentric,” traversing Australia’s most isolated savannah country. Meet the characters who operate it, those who travel the line and the locals who depend on “one of the great little railroads of the world.” Then, travel to the heartland of Queensland from Brisbane to Longreach, the birthplace of the oldest and safest operating airline in the English speaking world. Hear stories of how the Spirit of the Outback has affected the lives of drovers, bush poets and swaggies. Finally, discover a train without a schedule, the Savannah Lander. Journey to the tropical outback and see old gold fields and the largest lava tube system on Earth, Undara.

results.title: Three track
results.creator_credit: Intercom Films, Gilbert Taylor, Don Hopkins and Beryl Fox
results.brief_description: Looks at a ski school for pupils with physical disabilities. These ski devotees are coached by dedicated volunteer instructors from the Canadian Ski Alliance. They have worked together to accomplish what for some might seem an impossible task: to master the sport of skiing.

results.title: Three to go: Michael
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Gil Brealey and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Michael has to make decisions in the complex but permissive world of today. His friends have followed a relatively straight and narrow path of conformity. Michael has more or less taken this course, but knows that other ways exist. He is prepared to listen to the prophets of change and revolution and is taken on an excursion into the world of the young radical. In which world does Michael belong? Features Grahame Bond. Also available on DVD [319174].

results.title: Three to go: Judy
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Brian Hannant and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Judy is a young girl who lives in a large provincial city. Like most girls of her age, she longs to get out and see life, to find the fun, romance and adventure. She wants to go to the big city to work. The film shows the last few weeks before she leaves home. We meet her parents, workmates and boy friend. In their comments we discover some of the problems a teenage girl has to face when living in a large country town.

results.title: Three teenagers
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, Southern California Consortium and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Time to grow”.
Presents case studies of three teenagers from vastly different backgrounds. It demonstrates how environment and family relationships shape their growth and development.

results.title: Three students
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. This film is about three adults who have undertaken adult education courses.
